Command.name: redirect
Command.Help: Provides a VPN-like capability to forward TCP/UDP packets.

Option.name: tcp
Option.Help: Use TCP/IP as the redirection protocol

Option.name: udp
Option.Help: Use UDP/IP as the redirection protocol

Option.name: spx
Option.Help: Use SPX/IPX as the redirection protocol

Option.name: lplisten
Option.Help: Listen for new connections on the LP-side.

Option.name: implantlisten
Option.Help: Listen for new connections on the Implant-side.

Option.name: target
Option.Help: The address / port to which data should be forwarded.
NOTE: Data is always forwarded to the side opposite where the listening port is.

Option.name: bind
Option.Help: Address to which the listening port should bind (defaults to 0.0.0.0).

Option.name: compress
Option.Help: Compress the data while sending between EP and Implant. If the
stream that you are redirecting has already been encrypted or
compressed then you do not want to use this option.

Option.name: notify
Option.Help: Send notification of target connection success / failure to

Option.name: nodes
Option.Help: Sets the maximum number of buffered nodes allowed (0=no limit).
If this parameter is not specified, 0 is used.

Option.name: maxPacketSize
Option.Help: Sets the maximum size (in bytes) for recv/send calls. This is of
particular interest for datagram (ie, UDP) redirection. If no value
is specified, a default of 550 bytes is used.
